title: Volkswagen UK
subtitle: Automotive web apps
description: A series of web apps for Tribalâ€™s main client, Volkswagen UK, including Finance Calculator, Book a Service and Request a Test Drive. Built using React and TypeScript and configured using StoryBlok CMS. I played a key role in migrating all VWs web apps to React and implementing the Feature Hub micro-services architecture.

title: SEAT Cars UK
subtitle: Automotive web apps
description: Web apps for SEAT Cars UK, including Finance Calculator and Request a Test Drive forms. Built using React and TypeScript and configured using Jahia CMS with data from the Volkswagen API. As the sole frontend developer on the account I maintained and extended the two main apps and implemented Cypress e2e tests.

title: Skoda UK
subtitle: Automotive web apps
description: Tribal provided one main app for Skoda UK; the Book a Service form is closely based on the Volkswagen version of the app. Built using React and TypeScript and configured using StoryBlok CMS. As the main frontend developer on the account I maintained the app with a team of backend developers and QA engineers.

title: VIA Outlets
subtitle: European fashion outlet
description: VIA Outlets has 11 locations in 9 European countries and its sites are localised into multiple local languages. All content was designed to be editable by the client using StoryBlok headless CMS. I regularly added modules to the Fashion Club user section and contributed extensively to the  maintenance of the all the localised sites.

title: Wren Kitchens
subtitle: Kitchen showrooms
description: A showcase for Wren Kitchens new showroom in Levittown NY. I single handedly developed the section using vanilla HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

title: Simple Pattern
subtitle: iOS app
description: My Next Tube app built in Objective-C. The free iOS app displays arrival times for London Underground tube trains using data from TfL's API. I intitally developed the app in Objective-C before migrating to Swift.
